Situation A. Driving 50 Miles per Hour to Mackinac Island

  1. Make a table and a graph to show how the distance traveled changes as time passes from when the family leaves home to when they reach their destination.
  2. Write an equation relating distance traveled d to time t.
  3. Is the relationship between distance and time a linear function? Explain why or why not.

Situation B. Mr. Cordova’s Sister

  1. Mr. Cordova’s sister also lives in Detroit and is driving to Mackinac Island which is 300 miles from Detroit. She plans on 5 hours to drive to the Island. How fast will she have to drive to make it in 5 hours? How fast will she have to drive if she wants to go to Grand Marais, Michigan, 400 miles, in 5 hours?
  2. Write an equation relating distance traveled d to speed s.
  3. Is the relationship between the variables d and s a linear function? Explain.
